title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's broken-bat check swing during a Red Sox spring training game went viral on social media.
Abreu held his swing but his bat snapped, leaving him with only the handle against the Pittsburgh Pirates.
Abreu suggested prior contact may have weakened the bat, despite no evident break during his tests.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource aims to restore power to all customers in Eastern Massachusetts by midnight Friday after Monday's blizzard.
Approximately 160,000 customers were without power, with the hardest-hit areas being Cape Cod, Martha's Vineyard, and Plymouth.
Eversource teams, with outside help, are working 18-hour shifts to fix outages; some towns may see temporary de-energization.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hilary Knight criticized Donald Trump's joke about Team USA women's hockey, calling it distasteful and overshadowing their achievements.
Team USA men's hockey team laughed at Trump's joke, later expressing regret and respect for the women's team.
The U.S. women's hockey team declined Trump's invitation to the State of the Union due to scheduling conflicts.

title: Mike Vrabel on AJ Brown, Stefon Diggs’ future and Patriots’ free agency approach
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel discusses free agency plans and improving the team's roster after their Super Bowl appearance.
Stefon Diggs's future with Patriots uncertain amidst legal issues and a potential shift to younger, cheaper players.
Speculation surrounds potential Patriots trade for Eagles' A.J. Brown, with Vrabel reflecting on past relationship.

title: Charania: Jayson Tatum a ‘full-go’ during Celtics’ 5-on-5 scrimmages
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum has participated fully in Celtics' 5-on-5 scrimmages, signaling progress in his recovery from an Achilles injury.
Despite participating in practices, Tatum has not set a return date for games, focusing on improving strength and confidence.
Celtics allow Tatum to dictate his comeback timing, needing his scoring and versatility for their successful season stretch.

title: Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: School districts in Cape Cod and southeastern Massachusetts canceled classes through Friday due to blizzard impacts and power outages.
Barnstable, Falmouth, Plymouth, Taunton, and Mashpee schools cite road safety and infrastructure issues for extended closures.
Over 136,500 homes statewide remain without power, concentrating around Cape Cod and southeastern Massachusetts, hindering school operations.

title: Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly threatening a bus passenger with a .40-caliber Beretta in East Boston.
The incident occurred around 6 p.m. on an MBTA bus on Meridian Street, according to MBTA Transit Police.
The suspect has a prior conviction for illegal possession of a firearm, police reported on social media.

title: Explosion and fire at Taunton home seriously injures mother and 2-year-old child
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Explosion and fire destroy Taunton home at 78 Plain St., seriously injuring a mother and her 2-year-old child.
The mother (25) was hospitalized with severe burns; her child was taken to Hasbro Children’s Hospital with serious injuries.
The three-family home is a total loss, displacing eight residents; two nearby homes were also damaged.

title: Swayman: Team USA ‘should have reacted differently’ to Trump’s joke about US women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman of Team USA criticized their reaction to Trump's joke about the women's hockey team after a gold medal win.
The U.S. men's hockey team laughed at Trump's comment during a phone call; Swayman expressed regret over their reaction.
The U.S. women's team declined Trump's White House invitation due to prior commitments, despite appreciation for the invite.

title: MSPCA-Angell evacuates nearly 50 animals, opens shelter to pets from Cape homes without power
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: MSPCA-Angell evacuated nearly 50 animals from its Cape Cod shelter due to power outages and low generator fuel.
Evacuated animals were relocated to MSPCA-Angell's Nevins Farm and Boston shelters without any complications.
The Cape Cod shelter now temporarily houses pets from homes without power as part of the SafePet program.
